meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a clump.
meanings.sent1: The soil in the garden felt clumpish under my feet.
meanings.sent2: The rocks had a clumpish appearance, gathered together in a pile.
meanings.sent3: The clumpish clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, clumpish and tangled, was a mess after playing outside.
meanings.sent5: The clumpish texture of the mashed potatoes made them hard to swallow.

meanings.sent1: The clumpish plants in the garden grew close together.
meanings.sent2: The dough was too clumpish, so I added more water to make it smoother.
meanings.sent3: His clumpish way of organizing his toys made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent4: The clumpish crowd at the concert made it difficult to move around.
meanings.sent5: The clumpish snowflakes fell softly, covering the ground in white.

meanings.definition: In a clumpy or lumpy manner.
meanings.sent1: She stirred the soup clumpishly, leaving chunks of vegetables floating.
meanings.sent2: The paint was applied clumpishly, resulting in an uneven finish.
meanings.sent3: He walked clumpishly in his oversized boots, tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The batter was mixed clumpishly, creating pockets of flour in the cake.
meanings.sent5: The fabric draped clumpishly over the chair, wrinkling in odd places.
